Class PortfolioManager

java.lang.Object
org.stockmanager.service.PortfolioManager
public class PortfolioManager extends Object
Manages a user's portfolio, transactions, and interactions with stock market data. Provides functionality to deposit funds, buy and sell stocks, and maintain transaction history.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PortfolioManager(User user, Portfolio portfolio, List<Transaction> transactions, StockApiService apiService, DataStorage dataStorage)
    Constructs a new PortfolioManager with the given user, portfolio, transaction history, stock API service, and data storage for persistence.

  • Constructor Details

    • PortfolioManager

      public PortfolioManager(User user, Portfolio portfolio, List<Transaction> transactions, StockApiService apiService, DataStorage dataStorage)
      Constructs a new PortfolioManager with the given user, portfolio, transaction history, stock API service, and data storage for persistence.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose portfolio is managed.
      portfolio - The portfolio to manage.
      transactions - The user's transaction history.
      apiService - The service for fetching stock market data.
      dataStorage - The storage system for persisting changes.

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Retrieves the user associated with this portfolio manager.
      Returns:
      The user being managed.

    • getPortfolio

      public Portfolio getPortfolio()
      Retrieves the portfolio being managed.
      Returns:
      The user's portfolio.

    • getTransactions

      public List<Transaction> getTransactions()
      Retrieves the transaction history of the user.
      Returns:
      A list of transactions associated with the user.

    • deposit

      public void deposit(double amount)
      Deposits funds into the user's account.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to deposit. Must be positive.

    • calculateMaxShares

      public int calculateMaxShares(String symbol, double amount)
      Calculates the maximum number of whole shares of a stock that can be bought with a given amount.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The stock symbol.
      amount - The amount of money available to spend.
      Returns:
      The maximum number of whole shares, or -1 if the price cannot be fetched or is zero.

    • buyStock

      public boolean buyStock(String symbol, int quantity)
      Buys a specified quantity of stock if funds are sufficient.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The stock symbol to buy.
      quantity - The number of shares to buy.
      Returns:
      true if the purchase was successful, false otherwise.

    • sellStock

      public boolean sellStock(String symbol, int quantity)
      Sells a specified quantity of stock if the user owns enough shares.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The stock symbol to sell.
      quantity - The number of shares to sell.
      Returns:
      true if the sale was successful, false otherwise.
